lines.text: Pease porridge hot, pease porridge cold, pease porridge in the pot nine days old.
You have the distinction of owning the only two children in the entire building.
Oh, we don't own 'em, we just rent!

Well, let me give it to you straight Harry Boy! You see, I am a single, unattached guy. And I live upstairs, right above you. Now, I'm into swinging, and children having pillow fights at all hours of the night while I'm trying to score, may cause a few strikeouts, you get me Harry Boy!

[Referring to Wendy]
She tried to bite me!
Honey? Did you do a lot of drugs before we were married?

[after turning Malcolm into troll]
Welcome, Brother Elf
I know what death looks like. It looks like *this*!

[looking for Wendy in the basement]
Have you been playing with dead cats?

A gentle knight was riding across the plain, all clad in mighty arms and silver shield, wherein old dents and deep wounds did remain the cruel marks of many a bloody field. Yet armies till that time did he never yield. His angry steed did chide his foaming bit. Upon a great adventure he was bound, that fairest Gloriana to him gave, the greatest, glorious queen of fairyland. Now, when that idle dream was to him brought, unto that elfin knight he bade him fly, where he slept soundly, void of evil thought and with false shoes abuse his fantasy...
What can I do for you?
You have come to the right guy, uncle Duke has seen just about everything there is to see little missy, I've been around the world dozens of times staring death right in the face
Well I don't know, it's hard to explain, you're too young to understand anyway
I know what death looks like
That's good, that's good, what does it look like?
[transforms into Torok and speaks in his voice]
